WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing for tracking, please re-open when you have more info.
WorkItem.Description:
Well, title says it all. After installing the latest TS for both VS2012 and 2013, Intellisense in VS 2012 just, well, "dies".

This short [YouTube video shows the issue](http://youtu.be/08Vj1sB5Wnc) (sorry, tried attaching, but its slightly bigger than the file limit).

Hopefully this gets fixed - a big fan of TS, and understand it's not even v1 RTP...but still, it's getting to the point where dealing with issues gets in the way of, well, getting stuff done....

Keep up the great work!
WorkItem.Summary: 0.9.5 Intellisense dies on VS 2012 (side x side VS 2013)

Comments.Message: With the latest you mean 0.9.5 we releases today (12/5)?

Well, nope, it was 0.9.1.1 whis is/was the link presented in VS 2013 when you try and create a Typescript application (install template)....

I'll check the latest release and see if it resolves things and report back....

BTW, that "install template" also "stays" (in the TypeScript template list) even after install..no biggie, just odd :)

Thanks for your input!

Hi Paul - 

Here's the update on latest version 0.9.5:

* Above issue remains, no Intellisense on VS 2012, good on 2013

* "Old" annoyances remain:
   * Publishing your app, does not "publish" your script files (js), so nothing actually works in your "published app" - 'the fix" here is to include the "hidden" (nested, really), js file (it's there), and just don't open it (VS updates this file whenever you save your .ts file)

Obi Wan, err, Mads! We need you (Web Essentials) :)

More details:
* "0.9.5" shows up in control panel (Add/Remove) as version - 0.921127.0, yup I'm here to see if a complete "redo" does any good (uninstall/reboot/re-install).
* don't think I ever mentioned, though unsure if it matters, Win 8.1/64

Well, it was worth the effort just to go through the motions -

* Uninstall -> reboot -> reinstall == no joy

Issue and "annoyances" remain.

Updated title to scope issue more concisely....

When you say the js files are not being published, in what kind of project is this? Is it an existing project? Does the same happen in a new project?

Looking at the video TypeScript seems to be installed correct. Does the IntelliSense failure happen even in a new project?

Hi Paul -

Thanks for your time on this -

* _js files not being published - what type of project - existing/new?_
  __Any__, as the video shows, it's the standard "Greeter" sample for TS. This occurs on VS 2012 and VS 2013. The only "fix" I've been able to do is:
  * Show all files ->
  * Include the hidden js file in the project. If I do this, the Publish(ed) app is "complete" and functional.

* _does the intellisense failure happen in a new project?_
  __Yes__, but this is _only for VS 2012_. Intellisense works perfectly fine on VS 2013. So it seems it's a "side x side" issue (both VS 2012 and 2013 are installed)

Hmm...Closed??

Update: 
* On a machine with _only_ VS 2012 installed, this is __not__ an issue

So the side x side (VS 2012 and 2013) seems relevant. 

My machine that only has VS 2012, and therefore unaffected is on Windows 7.
I assume if folks were still seeing this issue we'd have heard of a more recent report. We do have side by side setups in our test matrix.
